abstract: GE Healthcare said that it agreed to buy Clarient, a molecular diagnostics firm, which it says will help the company better diagnose and characterize cancer, in a deal worth about $580 million.
snippet: GE Healthcare said that it agreed to buy Clarient, a molecular diagnostics firm, which it says will help the company better diagnose and characterize cancer, in a deal worth about $580 million.
lead_paragraph: GE Healthcare said Friday that it had agreed to buy Clarient, a molecular diagnostics firm, which it says will help the company better diagnose and characterize cancer, in a deal worth about $580 million.

headline.main: GE Health to Buy Clarient in $580 Million Deal
